div.p: NARRATOR: When people drink more alcohol than their liver can process at one time, the excess alcohol continues to circulate throughout the body.
NARRATOR: This excess alcohol disrupts the proper functioning of the brain and nerve cells, and thus the ability to respond becomes impaired.
NARRATOR: This happens because alcohol impacts how effectively our nervous system can pass messages between cells.
NARRATOR: So when impaired, it is impossible for the nervous system to perform as well as it does in a sober state.
NARRATOR: Extra effort and practice can help, but it cannot overcome alcohol or drug impairment.
NARRATOR: When cells become impaired, we often can't respond quickly enough or accurately enough to avoid problems...
NARRATOR: In some situations, a split second difference is all that stands between safety and tragedy.
